Posts.EditableText:
[u:14b3x2vt]Info / Story:[/u:14b3x2vt]
Havenhold is my new ORPG, set in a world of magic... and technology. The world has moved on from its medieval wizardry and now science has granted interstellar travel. But now magic has been outlawed in almost all sectors of the galaxy, plummeting it into a new dark age of corruptness and evil.

[u:14b3x2vt]Progress:[/u:14b3x2vt]
 * System:  ~ 35-40%.
 * Game Content: ~ 1%.

[u:14b3x2vt]Current Features:[/u:14b3x2vt]
* Register new accounts.
* Saved charaacters.
* Shops.
* Inventory.
* Equipable items.
* Time and weather system.
* Alignment.
* Dynamic player descriptions.
* Customisable appearances.
* Shapeshifting race!!
* NPCs that can follow you.
* Beautiful cities with whole populations.
* Fast travel, dragon style.
* Moving NPCs and monsters.

[u:14b3x2vt]Working on now:[/u:14b3x2vt]
* Major de-bugging.
* Stats!
* Battle system!
* Leveling and skills!

[u:14b3x2vt]Coming soon:[/u:14b3x2vt]
* Weight and encumberment.
* Quest log!
* Class quests.
* Huge wilderness.
* Huge world to explore.
* Hordes of monsters.
* Whole new continents!
* Dungeons.
* Laws and a bounty system.
* MAGIC!
* Trading between players!!!

[u:14b3x2vt]Notes:[/u:14b3x2vt]
If you have any ideas for the game or wish to help make it, please let me know. This game [u:14b3x2vt][b:14b3x2vt]WILL[/b:14b3x2vt][/u:14b3x2vt] take a long time to finish and from now on I [b:14b3x2vt]will not[/b:14b3x2vt] be giving anyone a copy unless I choose to as they are helping with testing, although I may give samples of the codes for open de-bugging or to people asking how to do certain stuff in questnet, that is all.

If you wish to sign up for the first alpha test please reply to this thread.

I will most likely be updating this thread will updates, but also on my site: [url=http://www.freewebs.com/depaw/havenhold.htm:14b3x2vt]DePawity: HavenHold Page[/url:14b3x2vt].

Info / Story:
Havenhold is my new ORPG, set in a world of magic... and technology. The world has moved on from its medieval wizardry and now science has granted interstellar travel. But now magic has been outlawed in almost all sectors of the galaxy, plummeting it into a new dark age of corruptness and evil.

Progress:
* System: ~ 35-40%.
* Game Content: ~ 1%.

Current Features:
* Register new accounts.
* Saved charaacters.
* Shops.
* Inventory.
* Equipable items.

If you wish to sign up for the first alpha test please reply to this thread.

I will most likely be updating this thread will updates, but also on my site: DePawity: HavenHold Page

Posts.EditableText: The next test release of the game will be for the stats and fighting system. Then I shall create a moderate sized world with a few quests and a dungeon or two and hold the first Alpha. Yes Alpha 1.0 is not that far away. It'll be private, so you'll need to sign up for it by telling me you're interested. I HOPE to get it out before my birthday as a kind of present to myself for all my hard work since late last year, my coding skills were very poor then and there were several failed game attempts, but that's all behind us now and my skills are up there will the elites. My birthday is 33 days aways, so wish me luck!! If you wish to help, please let me know, you name will go on the credits, I promise. I'm not really looking for programmers to help me, Tron has offered to check my codes for me, I'm looking for mappers, people with cool quest ideas, that sort of thing.

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="elexxorine":fhnw40ve]I think there's an internal firewall on the router, which is passworded and my brother in law will not remove it as he very over-secure. Thank you' Zelimos... I hope I can use you for a test server too?[/quote:fhnw40ve]

I can probably run atleast 5 QuestNet server simultaneously without any lag.  Just tell me when you need my server up and i'll put it up for you.  I have 2 jobs now so it's probably best to email me or leave me a message on MSN if I leave it online.

I already told you how to get passed that firewall password.  Just reset the router by pressing the reset button with a pen, and leave the password blank.  Then find the page where it has like options to disconnect one of the local IP addresses at a certain time (192.168.x.x where x is whatever numbers).

To find your local IP address goto Start -> Run -> cmd -> ipconfig

It should be something like 192.168.1.60  (the last 2 numbers can be anything from 2-99 I think).

Posts.EditableText:
At least, that's until her brother loads up his saved config file and just kickes her off the net for good....
... yeah, killer!

Why don't you look into UPnP? Write a little application which forwards all incoming connections to port 10000 to the computers' IP address?
.. If the router doesn't support UPnP it's rubbish, as they have for years (mine's 4-ish).

Posts.EditableText: Find a spare network card, and change it.
Posts.HTML: Find a spare network card, and change it.

Posts.EditableText:
And that solves the username/password settings!?

Changing what MAC is connecting to the router?
Hell, that could even stop you connecting to the router as he could (and *should*) have locked down which machines can connect to the router by using MAC addresses.

That way, an IP address is assigned to your MAC address and that way he can be sure that only your PC would be blocked by his access rule.
Posts.HTML:

That way, an IP address is assigned to your MAC address and that way he can be sure that only your PC would be blocked by his access rule.

Posts.EditableText:
I have 3 computers, one of which I can dedicate to it.

It's funny, resetting my router allowed me to clear the password on my router settings and access the admin controls.
Changing my network card a couple of years ago allowed me to stay on the internet, as the network card used a different local IP.

Well, either way it's no problem.  I can host still.

Posts.EditableText: For those still looking at this. I've made a new website, kindly hosted by Gameboy. The site is working nicely but the forum is currently giving me grief. All updates will be posted on the website. If anyone has any questions they can post them here. I'm currently trying out some new ideas for the way battles are done, with ideas of locations hitting, timers verses turns, etc. I'll be needing Alpha testers once 1.6 is ready. I'm not giving any date on this as I know I won't make it. Hopefully some time before I'm 105 . I am aiming for 1-2 hours of game play on release, it won't just be testing the engine and features but the idea of the game, concept, etc for workability. If you're interested, let me know. I'm looking for about 3-6 people for testing. Site: http://havenhold.nevetsweb.com
